intro: Latraeophila, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant is characterized by its hairy, silver-green leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in the evening. Its fruits are berries that turn from green to yellow as they mature. Latraeophila contains toxic alkaloids, making it potentially harmful to humans and animals.
